Isabela & Yuri





Nós nos casamos oficialmente no dia 05 de abril de 2023 em um
cartório de Brasília.



Como tínhamos acabado de voltar do Japão após a conclusão de nossos
cursos de doutorado e precisávamos começar a organizar logo em seguida
nossa mudança para a França, não tivemos tempo para celebrar o casamento
com todos os amigos e familiares.



Portanto, vamos celebrar nosso casamento no dia 17 de agosto de 2024
com uma cerimônia simbólica seguida de uma festa com jantar.



Essa será uma grande oportunidade que teremos de juntar todos nossos
amigos e familiares pela primeira vez em uma celebração. Por isso,
estamos muito felizes e ansiosos de poder compartilhar esse momento
especial com nossos entes queridos.



Ficaremos muito felizes e gratos pela sua presença na celebração do
nosso casamento!


We got married officially on April 5, 2023, at a registry office
in Brasília.



As we had just returned from Japan after completing our PhD
courses and needed to start organizing our move to France straight away,
we didn’t have time to celebrate the wedding with all our friends and
family.



Therefore, we will celebrate our wedding on August 17, 2024,
with a symbolic ceremony followed by a dinner party.



This will be a great opportunity for us to bring all our friends
and family together for the first time in a celebration. Therefore, we
are very happy and excited to be able to share this special moment with
our loved ones.



We will be very happy and grateful for your presence at our
wedding celebration!

Caso queira nos dar algum presente, gostaríamos de pedir que ele
seja dado em forma de dinheiro, por favor.



Como precisaremos viajar ao Brasil para a casamento e ainda não
temos uma moradia fixa, pedimos encarecidamente que evitem presentes em
forma de objetos.



O valor presenteado será usado para nos ajudar financeiramente nos
nossos momentos juntos pelo mundo! Muito obrigado!

To our friends coming from other countries, we know that
international travelling is very expensive, so please do not worry about
giving us presents. Just by having your presence at our wedding is the
best present you could give us. Thank you!

Isabela & Yuri





Nós nos conhecemos em Brasília, em um um ônibus indo para um evento
de universitários em 2012 e nos tornamos conhecidos, com amigos em
comum.



Nossa amizade só se concretizou de verdade em 2014 quando ambos
fomos estudar durante um intercâmbio na Universidade de Tsukuba, Japão.
Tínhamos aulas de língua japonesa juntos e a gente se encontrava com
frequência na Universidade, nas aulas, e de vez em quando a gente
almoçava junto com outros amigos.



Após o retorno à Brasília em 2015, nossos interesses e experiências
em comum fortaleceram nossa amizade e começamos a nos encontrar com mais
frequência. A gente se encontrava principalmente em eventos relaciados
ao Japão, por exemplo, em festivais e para ver filmes japoneses.



Os encontros nos tornaram cada vez mais próximos e resolvemos
oficializar o namoro no início de 2017. Logo tivemos que encarar
desafios, como um relacionamento à distancia quando a Isabela voltou ao
Japão em abril de 2017 para continuar os estudos após a graduação.



Mesmo assim, nosso relacionamento se manteve forte e pudemos nos
encontrar em pessoa novamente em setembro de 2017, quando o Yuri também
voltou à Universidade de Tsukuba a fim de continuar seus estudos.



Desde então, nos tornamos muito próximos e passamos por diversos
desafios da vida juntos, desde dividir um lar, estudar para cursos de
mestrados e doutorados, viver em países estrangeiros, passar por
diferentes empregos, etc. A vida tem sido uma grande aventura juntos,
onde passamos por mudanças emocionais, culturais e até geográficas um ao
lado do outro.



Logo nos primeiros meses quando começamos a morar juntos, já
pensamos em nos casar. Desde cedo, tínhamos a certeza de que queríamos
passar o resto de nossas vidas unidos.


Assim, o casamento foi mais uma etapa natural durante o processo das
nossas vidas. Esperamos até a conclusão de nossos cursos de doutorado
para voltar brevemente ao Brasil e oficializar nossa união em
Brasília.




Agora, continuamos seguindo essa grande aventura que é a vida a
dois!



Que venham mais experiências, sonhos, desafios e momentos memoráveis
e felizes!

We met in Brasília, in a bus going to a university event in 2012
and we became acquaintances, with mutual friends.



Our friendship only truly came to fruition in 2014 when we both
went to study during an exchange year at the University of Tsukuba,
Japan. We had Japanese language classes together and we met often at the
University, during classes, and from time to time we would have lunch
with other friends.



After returning to Brasília in 2015, our common interests and
experiences strengthened our friendship, and we began to meet more
frequently. We met mainly at events related to Japan, for example, at
festivals and to watch Japanese films.



With our dates we became increasingly closer, and we decided to
make our relationship official at the beginning of 2017. We soon had to
face challenges, such as a long-distance relationship when Isabela
returned to Japan in April 2017 to continue her studies after
graduation.



Even so, our relationship remained strong, and we were able to
meet in person again in September 2017, when Yuri also returned to the
University of Tsukuba to continue his studies.



Since then, we have become very close and have gone through many
of life’s challenges together, from sharing a home, studying for
master’s and doctorate courses, living in foreign countries, having
different jobs, etc. Life has been a great adventure together, where we
have experienced both emotional, cultural, and geographical changes
alongside each other.



Since the first few months when we started sharing our lives as
a couple, we already thought about getting married. From then on, we
were sure that we wanted to spend the rest of our lives
together.



So, marriage was another natural step in the process of our
lives. We waited until the completion of our doctoral courses to return
to Brazil soon and make our union official in Brasilia.



Now, we continue following this great adventure that is life
together!



Here’s to more experiences, dreams, challenges, and memorable
and happy moments!

Isabela & Yuri





VISA REQUIREMENTS

For those coming from abroad to celebrate with us please check your
country’s visa requirements.


Check this Brazilian consulate general website for a comprehensive
list:


https://www.gov.br/mre/pt-br/consulado-atlanta/english/visas/visa-requirements-by-country


It seems that applications for visas can only be completed through
Brazil’s E-consular platform.


It is advised to apply for your visa well in advance of your trip in
case there are system delays.


https://www.gov.br/mre/pt-br/consulado-atlanta/english/visas/visa-form



FLYING IN TO BRAZIL

If you are arriving directly to Brasilia, you will arrive at
Brasilia President Juscelino Kubitschek International Airport
(BSB).


If you are arriving directly to Sao Paulo, you will likely arrive at
Guarulhos International Airport (GRU).


You can take a taxi, Uber, or public transportation from the airport
to get to the city.


You can use research destination tools such as Expedia, Booking,
Skyscanner, Get Your Guide, Trip Advisor, and Google tools (Google Maps
have a lot of information as well).



GETTING AROUND

The easiest way around Brazilian cities is Uber. It is an easy way
to overcome the challenges of the language barrier.


When requesting an Uber, look at the number of rides a driver has
given in their profile. It is recommended to avoid drivers with low
numbers of rides. Uber Black drivers tend to meet these criteria better
than others, and due to the strength of the US Dollar, it is
affordable.



WORDS ABOUT SECURITY

While most have few issues in a city like Brasilia, crime still
exists. Here are a few general security things to keep in mind once you
leave the airport:
When traveling through the city, it is recommended to use the
buddy system. Traveling with someone else makes you less attractive as a
target.
Especially in busy or touristy areas, be cautious of your
belongings. A good practice is to have bags that zip up and keep them in
front of you to avoid pick pocketing.
Smartphones are a desirable target for petty crime due to their
size and value. Avoid walking on the street and looking down at your
phone, as it makes you vulnerable. To keep you safe, take the simple
precautions of walking inside a shop or building if you need to use your
phone.
Common theft schemes include groups, bicycles, and even children.
Especially in urban areas, thieves work in groups to misdirect or
escape. This can include one distracting you and the other
pickpocketing. Someone riding a bicycle may also try to grab your phone,
so again, stay away from the street with your phone.



TRAVELING AROUND BRAZIL

If you have the opportunity to stay in Brazil beyond the wedding
weekend, a few travel considerations:
Flights are the easiest transportation method to travel in this
huge country. Flights connect major tourist destinations like Rio de
Janeiro, Sao Paulo, Brasilia, and Recife.
If you choose to drive, highways in Brazil have speed cameras
every so often. If you turn on Waze, they will appear on the maps. It is
common for drivers to accelerate after the cameras and brake quickly
before them. Please be careful to avoid fines.
Ethanol gas is common and cheap in Brazilian gas stations. If you
rent a car, make sure your car can accept ethanol fuel.



SOME NICE DESTINATIONS

Brasília (Capital of Brazil)


Designed from scratch to be the capital of Brazil, the city has
several architectural buildings. The city has the shape of an airplane,
and the government buildings are located in the flight deck.
More Info: https://www.tripadvisor.com/Attractions-g303322-Activities-oa0-Brasilia_Federal_District.html


There are many other beautiful places to visit in Brazil.


Rio de Janeiro City


The most famous destination in Brazil, it is approximately 1h flight
from São Paulo city. We recommend you to stay in Ipanema or Copacabana
neighborhoods. Avoid driving in Rio, unless you will be driving to leave
the city. The rich neighborhoods are right next the favelas, which makes
it dangerous.
More Info: https://www.tripadvisor.com/Attractions-g303506-Activities-oa0-Rio_de_Janeiro_State_of_Rio_de_Janeiro.html


Iguazu Falls


Iguazu Falls are waterfalls of the Iguazu River on the border with
Argentina. Those falls are the largest waterfall system in the
world.


More Info: https://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g303444-d312332-Reviews-Iguazu_Falls-Foz_do_Iguacu_State_of_Parana.html


Capitolio, Minas Gerais State


A place for the ones who enjoy outdoor activities. In order to get
there, it is possible to drive from São Paulo or take a flight to Belo
Horizonte (Minas Gerais’ capital).


More Info: https://triptripnow.com/ecotourism-brazil-capitolio-minasgerais/


Northeast Beaches of Brazil


Although it is going to be winter in Brazil, the Northeast region is
always warm. Most of the beaches there are beautiful, you can research
destinations such as:
Salvador, Bahia state
Aracaju, Sergipe state
Maceió, Alagoas state
Maragogi, Alagoas state
Recife, Pernambuco state
Natal, Rio Grande do Norte state
Fortaleza, Ceará state
Jericoacoara, Ceará state


Since the colonization of Brazil started in the area, besides the
beaches, it is possible to sightsee historical buildings and
museums.
